summary: This document is an email chain regarding the procurement of security cameras for the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. It involves a Program Manager from SigNet Technologies/Convergint Federal Solutions ordering camera equipment to be shipped directly to the site, with a note about a discontinued part number.

persons.name: Program Manager
persons.role: Program Manager for FBOP Contracts at SigNet Technologies/Convergint Federal Solutions
persons.context: The individual sends an email ordering security cameras for the MCC New York job, specifying part number changes and shipping instructions.

events.title: Camera Order Authorization for MCC New York
events.description: The Program Manager receives clearance to order cameras for the MCC New York job and sends an email with specific part number changes and shipping instructions.

events.title: Order Confirmation for MCC New York Cameras
events.description: A response email acknowledges the order for cameras at MCC New York, referencing the procurement details.

locations: MCC New York (Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York)
12300 Kiln Ct Suite E, Beltsville, MD 20705 (SigNet Technologies/Convergint Federal Solutions office)
keyFacts: The document is an email chain dated August 19-20, 2019, regarding the procurement of security cameras for the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.
A Program Manager from SigNet Technologies/Convergint Federal Solutions orders cameras, noting that part number V942D-W312MIR replaces a discontinued original part.
The cameras are to be shipped directly to the MCC New York site, indicating a security or surveillance upgrade at the facility.
The correspondence occurs shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death at MCC New York on August 10, 2019, suggesting possible post-incident security enhancements.
